events.name: June Meetup: Bringing Big Data to Your Organization, Vertical Recommendation
events.description: Here are the topics for the June 10th meetup; additional details to follow. NOTE: This is a different PayPal office from the last meetup! #1 Panel: Brining Big Data into an Organization: War Stories from People on the Front Lines (45 minutes, 15 minute Q&A) • Axel Winter, Global Head of Process & Data Architecture, Standard Chartered Bank • Chris Choy, Assistant VP of SmartHub at StarHub • John Berns, SVP, Head of Data Science at Lazada • Adam Drake, CTO, Skyscanner #2 Paypal: “Vertical Recommendation using Collaborative Filtering” (25 minutes, 5 minute Q&A) #3 Presto in the Cloud Presto is a fast SQL query engine from Facebook. In this talk, I will talk about our experience offering Presto as a Service on Amazon Web Services as part of Qubole Data Services. In our world, Presto clusters are ephemeral - they are instantiated on demand and remain operational as long as necessary and shutdown when not used. We will talk about autoscaling mechanisms that allow the cluster to scale up or down depending on the amount of work in the system - translating to cost savings. We will also talk about caching data in SSDs on new instance types that improves queries over frequently accessed regions of data. We will talk about how query performance improves considerably using the ORC format and present performance numbers to illustrate how Presto can be a great option for fast SQL execution in the cloud. About the speaker Hello there! I'm Siva Narayanan. In my current employment at Qubole, I strive to make Hadoop, Hive and Presto behave well in the cloud. Earlier, I worked on query processing and workload aspects in the Greenplum Parallel Database. I did my undergrad at BITS, Pilani, India and my Ph.D. in Computer Science at The Ohio State University.
events.location: PayPal, Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985, Singapore

events.name: Let's meet up, talk about creativity & edutainment around drinks!
events.description: We start our Future Family Meet Up group with a casual exchange about creativity, what we all do and see if there couldn't be some synergies between some of us. Whether you're a creative mind, working in an edutainment start up, bringing quality and imagination to kids in Singapore, you might be interested in our group. Our sponsor Unity, "the ultimate tool for video game development", is offering the first drink!
events.location: Kapok Cafe, #01-05 National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, Singapore
events.group_name: Future Family: learning through play & real virtual world

events.name: Women in Tech: Innovation with Cloud
events.description:
Want to find out more about cloud and mobile, or get better at it? Come join us for a night learning to compose in Bluemix & hear from a panel of leading ladies in STEM on innovations in the cloud. Join us over dinner to meet great folks and take a step towards bigger things! 
Programme: 
6.30-7.00pm : Registration & dinner 
7.00-8.00pm : Composing in Bluemix - Bring your laptop/tablet/smartphone (might have to squint) for a handson session  
8.00-8.30pm : STEM Panel with leading ladies on what they do and how they innovate in cloud 
Our cloudmix trainer: 




Ms Irma Kusuma  MobileFirst Tech Manager, ASEAN  IBM



Meet our leading STEM ladies for our panel (more to follow): 




 
Ms Kwok Jen Nie   
Chief Executive, Xcellink Pte Ltd 


 
Ms Lai Siong CHEONG  Technical Sales Leader, ASEAN, IBM 


 
Ms Christine LIU  Founder StaffOnDemand  

 



 
 Dr. Meri Rosich, MBA, PhD 
 Founder at QualityTime and AppStrategyLabs
events.location: JFDI.ASIA @ Blk 71, , 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #05-16, SINGAPORE 139951

events.name: Haskell Meetup in June
events.description: Here comes Haskell Meetup in June. This month we have three talks. # Talks * Open Problems in Cross Compilation using Haskell on ARM (iOS), by Moritz * hpack: An alternative format for Haskell packages, by Simon * A tutorial on Damas Hindley Milner type system, by Paul * getopt-generics, by Sönke Hahn [ http://hackage.haskell.org/package/getopt-generics ] # Speakers, in lexical order Moritz Angermann: http://www.lichtzwerge.de Paul Meng: http://paulme.ng Sönke Hahn: https://github.com/soenkehahn Simon Hengel: http://typeful.net
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard
